intro: Forbesia elongata, commonly known as the long-stemmed forbesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, leathery leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Forbesia elongata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance once established.
